popt4jlib
Class BoolVector

java.lang.Object
  popt4jlib.BoolVector
public class BoolVector
extends java.lang.Object

represents a vector of booleans (alternative to BitSet, or Set<Long> that in fact may hold bit-sets of arbitrarily large size). Original version by Daniel Lemire on GitHub: https://github.com/lemire/Code-used-on-Daniel-Lemire-s-blog/blob/master/2012/11/13/src/StaticBitSet.java which however is now greatly enhanced with significantly more functionality. Notes:

  • The class is not thread-safe (to avoid paying locking costs). Clients must ensure no race-conditions exist when using this class.
  • 2016-01-27: The and(BoolVector), or(BoolVector) operations execute in parallel in the face of very large data lengths (above 1mio bits stored in both vectors to be and-ed). The implementation is modeled after the pattern in popt4jlib.MSSC.GMeansMTClusterer which turned out to be almost twice as fast as the generic parallel.ParallelBatchTaskExecutor.

Title: popt4jlib

Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2016

Company:

Version:
1.0
Author:
Ioannis T. Christou

nextSetBit

public int nextSetBit(int i)
method used to iterate over the set-bits in this vector. Use as in the following example: 
 
 for(int i=bv.nextSetBit(0); i>=0; i=bv.nextSetBit(i+1)) {
   // operate on index i
 }

Parameters:
i - int
Returns:
int -1 when there is no set bit after the input argument position.

equivalent to the retainAll(set) operation on Set. Utilizes parallel processing when the _data array length is long enough.

public void or(BoolVector other)
